questions.question: Why can a '3 bullish : 1 bearish' pattern count still fail to produce a buy signal?
options: Because the HMM regime and confidence can overrule raw pattern counts
questions.explanation: Pattern counts are context; the probabilistic regime and confidence determine edge.

questions.question: If 25% of bullish engulfings historically succeed and you saw 3 of them in 30 days, what is the naive probability of at least one success (independent events)?
Explain how clustering similar patterns can cause false positives.
questions.answer_text: Highly correlated signals double-count the same information, inflating perceived edge.
